alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 2:02AM EDT until July 10 at 5:30AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN CALEDONIA, ESSEX AND EAST CENTRAL ORLEANS COUNTIES... At 202 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.50 inch in 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Island Pond, Lyndon, St. Johnsbury, Ferdinand, East Haven, Brunswick, Granby, Brighton, Maidstone State Park, Newark, Lewis, Newark Hollow, Bloomfield, Maidstone, Victory, Burke, Averys Gore, West Burke Village, Warren Gore and Guildhall. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
